citation.article-title: Rubritalea halochordaticola sp. nov., a carotenoid-producing verrucomicrobial species isolated from a marine chordate
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rubritalea halochordaticola sp. nov.

Rubritalea halochordaticola [ha.lo.chor.da.ti′co.la. Gr. n. hals halos sea; N.L. pl. n. Chordata scientific name of an animal phylum; L. suff. -cola (from L. n. incola) inhabitant; N.L. n. halochordaticola inhabitant of marine chordates].
Cells are Gram-negative-staining, non-motile, obligately aerobic and rod-shaped.
Cells are 0.5–0.8 µm in width and 1.0–1.5 µm in length.
Neither cellular gliding movement nor swarming growth is observed.
Colonies grown on 1/2 strength R2A agar (Difco) with 75 % artificial seawater are circular, convex and reddish pink.
The temperature range for growth is 20–37 °C.
Optimal growth occurs at 30–37 °C; no growth occurs at 4 °C or 45 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.5–9.0.
NaCl not required for growth; tolerates concentrations of up to 7 % (w/v) NaCl.

Tests for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are positive, but tests for esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C4), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are negative.

Dextrin, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, d-glucose, lactose, lactulose, maltose, methyl β-d-glucoside, trehalose, furanose, methylpyruvate, d-glucuronic acid, alaninamide, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-glutamic acid, l-serine and l-threonine are oxidized.
The major respiratory menaquinone is MK-9.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains muramic acid and meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Major fatty acid components (>1.0 %) include iso-C14 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.
The type strain, MN1-1006T ( = KCTC 23186T = NBRC 107102T), was isolated from a marine ascidian from Sado Island, Japan.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 51.4 mol%.
